title: How I Designed My Swiss-Style Portfolio
content:
After years of experimenting with flashy effects, I decided to embrace the clarity and discipline of Swiss/Scandinavian design. This post walks through my process, from grid systems to accent colors, and how minimalism can actually make your work stand out more.

  • Start with a strict grid and lots of whitespace.
  • Use a single accent color for rhythm and focus.
  • Let typography and structure do the heavy lifting.

Here is a sample CSS grid setup:

main {
  display: grid;
  grid-template-columns: 1fr min(900px, 100%) 1fr;
}

title: كيف أكتب مدونة بتصميم سويسري (مثال بالعربية)
content:
هذه أول تدوينة لي باللغة العربية باستخدام أسلوب التصميم السويسري البسيط والواضح. أستعرض هنا كيف يمكن الجمع بين الجمال والوضوح في عرض المحتوى.

  • استخدم شبكة واضحة ومساحات بيضاء واسعة.
  • لون تمييزي واحد فقط.
  • اهتم بالخطوط والهيكل.

مثال على كود CSS:

body {
  direction: rtl;
  font-family: 'Inter', sans-serif;
}

title: How I Solved a Real-World Cybersecurity Challenge
content:
Recently, I participated in a Capture The Flag (CTF) event where I had to exploit a Linux misconfiguration. Here's how I approached the problem and what I learned.

Step 1: Analyzing the Service

The challenge provided SSH access to a sandboxed environment. I started by running ps aux and netstat -tulnp to see what was running.

Step 2: Finding the Vulnerability

I noticed a world-writable cron job:

ls -l /etc/cron.d/\n-rw-rw-rw- 1 root root  42 Apr 20 12:00 backup

I edited the cron file to run my own script, and within a minute, I had a shell as root!

Takeaways
  • Always check for misconfigurations.
  • World-writable files are dangerous.
  • Automation (like cron) can be a double-edged sword.
